intro: Crabbea cirsioides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branched. Crabbea cirsioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
